main event: A civilian observer spotted a bright, round, metallic object in the sky over Tempe, Arizona in March 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be hovering or stationary in the southwest sky, higher than the stars but lower than the normal altitude of aircraft.
The object was estimated to be 5-10 miles away and 2-3 times larger than a star in size.
No motion, sound, trail, or other distinguishing features were observed.
The witness had previously read a report on unidentified flying objects in Reader's Digest, which may have influenced their perception.
The object simply disappeared from view after being observed for 10-15 minutes.
